meanings.definition: The study of three-dimensional structures using two-dimensional sections.
meanings.sent1: In stereology, researchers analyze 2D slices to understand 3D shapes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use stereology to examine the structure of objects in 3D space.
meanings.sent3: The students found a fun way to learn about stereology by creating 3D models from 2D drawings.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the city from a bird's eye view gave me a sense of stereology in action.
meanings.sent5: The concept of stereology became clear when I visualized a cube from its flat projections.

meanings.definition: A method of quantifying spatial relationships within biological tissues.
meanings.sent1: Researchers apply stereology to measure distances between cells in tissues.
meanings.sent2: The use of stereology helps scientists understand the arrangement of cells in organs.
meanings.sent3: The biologist used stereology to play a game of 'cellular Tetris' in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Thinking of the tissues as a city map, stereology allowed for precise navigation.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of stereology lies in its ability to reveal hidden patterns within tissues.
